link.title: Postcards From Planet Google
link.description: The Google search engine has become a global phenomenon, with 50 million queries a day from over 100 countries.
link.comment: The possibilities of using Google's query database are just amazing. They really do have the pulse of the world under their finger.

link.title: Sex Urged for More Productivity
link.description: An international conference on sex in Singapore claims that healthy sex lives make happy workers, who will in turn create a more robust economy.
link.comment: No comment needed... Obviously I like their reasoning :)

link.title: Grounded
link.description: A federal agency confirms that it maintains an air-travel blacklist of 1,000 people. Peace activists and civil libertarians fear they're on it.
link.comment: The article is a bit speculative in parts, but still a very eye-opening read.

link.title: A Vote for Less Tech at the Polls
link.description: Criticism of computerized touch-screen voting machines.

link.title: Mailed Ballots Missing in Runoff Election Snafu
link.description: Ballots in a vote-by-mail runoff election remain undelivered to some city residents. Berkeley's use of bulk, rather than first-class, mail is blamed.

link.title: Man cleared of removing girl's teeth
link.description: A man has been found not guilty of removing 18 of his girlfriend's teeth while they were both high on the hallucinatory drug GHB.
link.comment: Must have been quite a trip to see a giant fly trying to choke you to death :) "The couple, who are still together, have since stopped taking GHB."

link.title: He's ba-a-ck!
link.description: America's public enemy No. 1 has suddenly reappeared -- and the White House doesn't care.

link.title: Will the real Bill Wyman please tune up?
link.description: Journalist Bill Wyman receives a "cease-and-desist" letter asking him to stop using his own name because it is "owned" by famed Rolling Stones bassist Bill Wyman.
link.comment: I swear, lawyers just have nothing better to do sometimes. Sending a cease-and-desist over the use of your own name in your own article??

link.title: Exploring alternative syntaxes for XML
link.description: XML's syntax has brought many benefits due to its interoperability, yet it can be tiresome to author XML documents. Edd Dumbill examines a range of alternative syntaxes for XML, and discusses their benefits and drawbacks.

link.title: Too Much Screen Time Can Make Computer Users Sick
link.description: The more time an office worker toils in front of a computer, the more likely he or she is to suffer a host of physical, mental and sleep-related ills, Japanese researchers report.
link.comment: I always knew that using the computer so much wasn't good for me.
